item.title: Near Reality OSS Bot Loader
item.dc:creator: @Smokey2 Smokey_
item.description:
@Smokey2 wrote:

You gotta be trollin’ bro. If not though, you’re loading an RSPS client, but you’re returning a runescape address for the code base(I do believe this overrides the client getCodeBase() method?(it needs to be the servers IP address)).

Besides that the only problem I see is that the client you’re loading can’t find the “details2.ini” file. This could throw an exception and render the client not loadable.

Oh yeah and call the pack() method. Not only that, but remove theGame panel, it’s unnecessary unless you plan on adding more components, in which case BorderLayout is not a good solution. UNLESS, you only want to add a menu bar.

Oh, and you might want to add

lol or just set the “theGame” panel as your content pane.

Read full topic

item.title: Near Reality OSS Bot Loader
item.dc:creator: @ploxkid ploxkid
item.description:
@ploxkid wrote:

I am new to making bots, and I decided I may as well try to make one using Javassist. To test my bot, I made a loader for the server Near Reality OSS. I do not intend to actually bot on the server, but want to learn how to do these sorts of things.

Currently, I am using this code for my loader:

[code]import java.applet.Applet;
import java.applet.AppletContext;
import java.applet.AppletStub;
import java.awt.BorderLayout;
import java.awt.Dimension;
import java.net.URL;
import java.net.URLClassLoader;
import java.util.HashMap;

import javax.swing.JFrame;
import javax.swing.JPanel;

public class RSLoader extends JFrame implements AppletStub {

    private static final HashMap<String, String> parameters = new HashMap<String, String>();

    public RSLoader() {
            try {
                    parameters.put("worldid", "1");
                    parameters.put("members", "0");
                    parameters.put("modewhat", "0");
                    parameters.put("modewhere", "0");
                    parameters.put("settings", "kKmok3kJqOfSioVfCQagIWtHEqGOCcTkj338a649PWg");
                    parameters.put("lang", "0");
            
                    ClassLoader clientClassLoader = new URLClassLoader(
                                            new URL[] { new URL(
                                                            "http://www.nrclient.com/webclient/client.jar") });
                    
                    Class<?> clientClass = clientClassLoader.loadClass("client");
                    Applet loader = (Applet) clientClass.newInstance();
                    loader.setStub(this);

                    setTitle("Runescape Loader ~ The Bank");
                    JPanel theGame = new JPanel(new BorderLayout());
                    theGame.setPreferredSize(new Dimension(768, 560));
                    setDefaultCloseOperation(EXIT_ON_CLOSE);
                    setSize(768, 560);
                    loader.init();
                    loader.start();
                    theGame.add(loader);
                    getContentPane().add(theGame, BorderLayout.CENTER);
                    
            } catch (Exception e) {
                    e.printStackTrace();
            }
    }

    public void appletResize(int width, int height) { }

    public final URL getCodeBase() {
            try {
                    return new URL("http://world37.runescape.com/");
            } catch (Exception e) {
                    return null;
            }
    }

    public final URL getDocumentBase() {
            try {
                    return new URL("http://world37.runescape.com/");
            } catch (Exception e) {
                    return null;
            }
    }

    public final String getParameter(String name) {
            return parameters.get(name);
    }

    public final AppletContext getAppletContext() {
            return null;
    }

    public static void main(String[] args) {
            new RSLoader().setVisible(true);
    }

}[/code]

Upon running this Loader, this is the output I get on the console:

Added 3 Short Keys! Running in highmem Couldn't find details2.ini Running in highmem

The window also stay the default gray and nothing happens… What is the problem here?

Thanks in advance.

Read full topic
